data.event: The land on which the suburb now stands was purchased in 1853 by Alfred Watts and Philip Levi.
The land on which the suburb now stands was purchased in 1853 by Alfred Watts and Philip Levi.

event.title: laid out the Village of Croydon in 1855

data.event: They laid out the Village of Croydon in 1855, comprising Croydon Farm of 40 acres (16 ha) and lots of up to 5 acres (2.0 ha).

event.title: 2006 Census by the Australian Bureau of Statistics counted

data.event: The 2006 Census by the Australian Bureau of Statistics counted 1,350 persons in Croydon on census night.
69.5% of residents were over 25 years in 2006, compared to the Australian average of 66.5%; and 30.5% were younger than 25 years, compared to the Australian average of 33.5%.
69.5% of residents were over 25 years in 2006, compared to the Australian average of 66.5%; and 30.5% were younger than 25 years, compared to the Australian average of 33.5%.
